title: Authors and Citation
text: David Rey. Author. Pelayo Arbues. Author. Fernando Lopez. Author. Antonio Paez. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rey-Blanco, D., 2022. Title. Environment Planning B XX (X), XXX-XXX, https://doi.org/
code: @Article{,   author = {{David Rey-Blanco} and {Pelayo Arbues} and {Fernando Lopez} and {Antonio Paez}},   title = {{A geo-referenced micro-data set of real estate listings for Spain’s three largest cities}},   year = {2022},   journal = {{Environment and Planning B}}, }

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: {idealista18} open data product big geo-referenced micro-data sets 2018 real estate listings Spain. data originally published idealista.com real estate website. data sets three largest cities Spain: Madrid (n = 94,815 observations), Barcelona (n = 61,486 observations), Valencia (n = 33,622 observations), include approximate coordinates properties (latitude longitude), asking prices listed dwelling, several variables indoor characteristics. listings enriched official information Spanish cadastre (e.g., building material quality) plus relevant geographical features, distance urban points interest. Along real estate listings, data product also includes neighborhood boundaries city. data sets offered fully documented R package available scientific educational purposes, particularly geo-spatial studies.

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: can install package GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("paezha/idealista18")

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: nine data objects package: three objects cities included. city, dwelling listings, neighborhood polygons, set points interest included R package. following subsections describe object. full description data available help section package.
code: library(dplyr) # A Grammar of Data Manipulation #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) # Create Elegant Data Visualisations Using the Grammar of Graphics library(idealista18) # Idealista 2018 Data Package #library(kableExtra) # Construct Complex Table with 'kable' and Pipe Syntax library(sf) # Simple Features for R #> Linking to GEOS 3.9.1, GDAL 3.3.2, PROJ 7.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(skimr)

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: dwelling listing city includes set characteristics dwelling published idealista real estate website ad. dwelling listing included ‘idealista18’ package sf object. name sf object containing dwelling listing includes name city, followed ’_Sale’ (e.g., Madrid_Sale) includes total 42 variables. sf object includes complete set listings corresponding four quarters year 2018. Table shows number dwelling listing ads included data set city quarter. record counts city : 94,815 listings Madrid, 61,486 Barcelona, 33,622 Valencia. Note dwelling may found one period property listed sale one quarter sold subsequent quarter. variable ASSETID, included sf objects, unique identifier dwelling. Data summary Variable type: factor Variable type: numeric Data summary Variable type: factor Variable type: numeric Data summary Variable type: factor Variable type: numeric Due data protection requirements, coordinates prices anonymized introducing slight degree random noise, details process please find process code folder named “anonyzation”.
code: Madrid_Sale |>   sf::st_drop_geometry() |>    skimr::skim() Barcelona_Sale |>   sf::st_drop_geometry() |>    skimr::skim() Valencia_Sale |>   sf::st_drop_geometry() |>    skimr::skim()

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: second block data included ‘idealista18’ R package spatial features three cities divided neighborhoods. sf object city name city suffix ’_Polygons’. Figure shows quantile maps number dwellings listing different neighborhoods three cities. neighborhoods based official boundaries slightly changed Idealista. practical terms, can assume since website combines areas ads area. case Madrid, combined four areas two. total 69 neighborhoods Barcelona, 135 Madrid, 73 Valencia. sf object includes unique identifier (LOCATIONID) neighborhood name (LOCATIONNAME).

title: Idealista 2018 Data Package
text: last block data included data package set Points Interest city object class list. name list includes name city suffix ’_POIS’. lists include three elements: () coordinates city center, central business district; (ii) set coordinates define main street city; (iii) coordinates metro stations.

title: Sale prices of residential property in Barcelona in 2018. — Barcelona_Sale
text: object class `sf` (inherits `data.frame`) 84,280 rows 57 variables: ASSETID Unique identifier asset PERIOD Date YYYYMM, indicates quarter ad extracted used YYYY03 1st Q, YYYY06 2nd, YYYY09 3rd YYYY12 4th PRICE Asking price ad idealista expressed euros UNITPRICE Price euros per square meter CONSTRUCTEDAREA Home built area sq.m ROOMNUMBER Number bedrooms BATHNUMBER Number bathrooms HASTERRACE Dummy variable terrace (takes 1 terrace, 0 otherwise) HASLIFT Dummy variable lift (takes 1 lift building, 0 otherwise) HASAIRCONDITIONING Dummy variable AA (takes 1 AA, 0 otherwise) AMENITYID Indicates amenities included (1 - furniture, kitchen amenities, 2 - kitchen amenities, furniture, 3 - kitchen amenities, furniture) HASPARKINGSPACE Dummy variable parking (takes 1 parking included Ad, 0 otherwise) ISPARKINGSPACEINCLUDEDINPRICE Dummy variable parking (takes 1 parking included Ad, 0 otherwise) PARKINGSPACEPRICE Price parking Space euros HASNORTHORIENTATION Dummy variable orientation (takes 1 orientation North Ad, 0 otherwise) - Important note: orientation features orthogonal features, house oriented north can also oriented east HASSOUTHORIENTATION Dummy variable orientation (takes 1 orientation South Ad, 0 otherwise)  - Important note: orientation features orthogonal features, house oriented north can also oriented east HASEASTORIENTATION Dummy variable orientation (takes 1 orientation East Ad, 0 otherwise)  - Important note: orientation features orthogonal features, house oriented north can also oriented east HASWESTORIENTATION Dummy variable orientation (takes 1 orientation West Ad, 0 otherwise)  - Important note: orientation features orthogonal features, house oriented north can also oriented east HASBOXROOM Dummy variable boxroom (takes 1 boxroom included Ad, 0 otherwise) HASWARDROBE Dummy variable wardrobe (takes 1 wardrobe included Ad, 0 otherwise) HASSWIMMINGPOOL Dummy variable swimming pool (takes 1 swimming pool included Ad, 0 otherwise) HASDOORMAN Dummy variable doorman (takes 1 doorman building, 0 otherwise) HASGARDEN Dummy variable garden (takes 1 garden building, 0 otherwise) ISDUPLEX Dummy variable duplex (takes 1 duplex, 0 otherwise) ISSTUDIO Dummy variable bachelor apartment (studio Spanish) (takes 1 single-person apartment, 0 otherwise) ISINTOPFLOOR Dummy variable indicating apartment located top floor (takes 1 top floor 0 otherwise) CONSTRUCTIONYEAR Construction year (source: advertiser) FLOORCLEAN Indicates flat floornumber starting 0 value groung floor (source: advertiser) FLATLOCATIONID Indicates kind views flat (1 - external, 2 - internal) CADCONSTRUCTIONYEAR Construction year cadastral source (source: cadastre), note figure can differ one given advertiser CADMAXBUILDINGFLOOR Max building floor (source: cadastre) CADDWELLINGCOUNT Dwelling count building (source: cadastre) CADASTRALQUALITYID Cadastral quality (source: cadastre) BUILTTYPEID_1 Dummy value flat condition: 1 new development 0 otherwise (source: advertiser)) BUILTTYPEID_2 Dummy value flat condition: 1 second hand restored 0 otherwise (source: advertiser)) BUILTTYPEID_3 Dummy value flat condition: 1 second hand good condition 0 otherwise (source: advertiser)) DISTANCE_TO_CITY_CENTER Distance center city km DISTANCE_TO_DIAGONAL Distance Avinguda Diagonal km; Diagonal major street cuts across city diagonally street grid geometry geometry simple features object class sf (inherits data.frame) 61486 rows 42 columns.
